The formula states:
Yin and Yang revolve, qi transforms into essence,
essence into cinnabar, cinnabar into mercury,
mercury into gold, gold into medicine—
thus called "golden sand," named the Great Return.
The Great Return means the meaning of returning.
"Elixir" is the name of the red color.
"Mercury" is fundamentally gold;
gold and water restrain each other,
hence called "golden sand."
When the fundamental body is refined, it is called the Great Return Elixir.
Earth is the Yin tally, the central palace of Wu and Ji,
also called the Five Qi Golden Crucible.

The formula states:
The Five Qi restrain and subdue without flying,
able to generate the Five Colors,
returning to their mother—
ingested, they grant longevity.

The formula states:
Cinnabar is the father of flowing mercury.
Wu and Ji are the mother of yellow gold.
The mother’s number is five; five is earth.
Using earth as the crucible,
its restraining power is called the Golden Crucible.
Earth can generate the myriad things;
gold is born of earth, thus it is the father of gold.
The mother is gold’s fundamental origin in earth,
hence called the earth mother.
Water regards earth as its ghost—
earth fills water so it does not rise.
The merit of Wu and Ji is called the Five Tally Golden Crucible.
Mercury cannot be subdued without earth.
Earth rules the realm of metal;
the three substances all seek it,
following the image of the emperor and king.
As when a ruler has the Dao, the four directions come to offer tribute.
Simply discern the true lead and mercury—
this is the primary crucible method.
Thus, the three substances form one family,
all returning to Wu and Ji.
Without earth to govern, gold and water cannot form the Elixir.

The earth mother reigns for eighteen days in each season;
the remaining days are abandoned, imprisoned, or concealed.
In refining the Golden Crucible,
investigate Yin and Yang,
the essence and qi returning—
the clepsydra does not cease.
Realgar is likened to earth, pacifying the four barbarians.
Earth is the fundamental soil that generates gold.
"Xiong" means male; "huang" means earth.
It can suppress water and earth—
this is metal and fire, unrelated to realgar.
The crucible’s outer master is called the Five Tally.

The world does not awaken to the Elixir’s fundamental father and mother,
mistakenly using gold and silver as the mother
or as crucible vessels.
Thus, the primordial qi does not depart from the Five,
and the Five do not depart from the primordial qi.
Their names are blended as one,
but their functions differ when distinguished.
The primordial qi is the ruler of the Five Agents;
the Five Agents are the ministers of the primordial qi.
Ruler and ministers govern in tandem—
they cannot be separated.
The Golden Elixir employs the primordial qi,
not exceeding the Five.
The Five are the Five Tally.
The Five Tally are qi.
Qi is originally formless,
born from essence,
containing truth within and without.
When ingested, one neither dies nor is born.

The Golden Crucible is the outer control of the medicine—
the outer is qi, the control is the crucible.
The crucible resembles a hen’s egg,
white outside encasing yellow,
combined with mercury—
using white gold as the vessel,
the vessel does not depart from the Five.
The Five are earth, the earth that generates gold.
Through intricate mutual restraint,
it seems effortless,
preventing water from escaping—
this is the merit of Wu and Ji.

The formula states:
Grasp the sword, lay down the halberd,
encompassing the four directions.
Grasping the sword is the primordial qi of metal, the Five.
Laying down the weapons—
like water meeting earth and not flowing—
this is gold dying in earth.

The foundation of the Great Elixir is cinnabar.
Cinnabar is lead,
fundamentally born of earth,
and in death also returns to earth—
thus, use the earth that generates cinnabar.
The world knows this in number.

The crucible has alternate names:
Outer Spirit Water, Flowery Pond, Spirit Chamber,
Enclosing Frame, Outer Control, Five Qi,
White Robe, Elixir Robe, Mother’s Abode,
Golden Crucible, Spirit Hut.

The formula states:
The Five Qi—
in greatness, they encompass the eight directions;
in smallness, they conceal even a hair’s tip.
They spit forth Kun and vomit forth Xu,
emerging from existence, entering non-existence.

The formula states:
The flowing pearl revolves nine times,
transforming into yellow and white.
Naturally interacting,
one Yin, one Yang—
this is called the Dao.
It must be subdued within the Golden Crucible,
the merit of the central palace.
Spiritual penetration is free and unobstructed,
nurturing and subduing—
hence called the Golden Crucible.

The Golden Elixir is the primordial harmonious qi of Heaven, Earth, sun, and moon.
Shining and silently revolving,
it becomes cinnabar.
Within the sand, it spontaneously generates—
this is the Return Elixir.
Like humans conceiving sons and daughters,
all arise from the union of father and mother’s Yin-Yang essence and qi—
thus, the Return Elixir resembles male and female.
Males are born facing downward; females, upward.
Not only in life—
even in death, it is so.
Simply cast them into water:
males float downward, females upward.
Heaven causes this—
it is not by the parents’ instruction.

Gold and water within the crucible
resemble male and female playing,
male above, female below,
naturally attaining mutual affinity,
fulfilling the Dao.

The formula states:
Though the Golden Elixir obtains its primordial foundation,
one must know the nurturing and subduing of its fundamental father and mother.
The father is the Yang qi of fire—
the father can emit, move, and complete it.
The mother is the Yin qi of earth—
the mother can contain and nurture it.
The mother rules the central palace, yellow—
yellow is earth, the earth that generates gold.
When cinnabar first receives qi,
it relies on earth to be born—
thus, it is called the fundamental mother of the yellow sprout.
Formed by Yang, born by the mother—
hence named the earth cauldron, the mother.

Earth is the earth of the Five Agents,
the earth of generation and completion.
Water, fire, wood, metal, earth—
each resides in its direction,
moving to its proper position.
Fire comes to overcome metal;
earth comes to overcome water.
Water is the child of cinnabar.
Earth is the crucible.
Fire is movement, contending—
yet forming shape, obtaining earth’s generation.
Earth can restrain water;
the fundamental qi resonate,
becoming the ancestral Dao.
Thus it is said: Know the white, guard the black.

The world entirely does not know that like kinds
follow and generate each other,
overcome and restrain each other—
metal generates water,
earth is the ghost of water.
Earth fills water so it does not rise—
the merit of Wu and Ji is called the Five Tally Golden Crucible.
None among the world’s people know this.
Earth tally is the essence of fire and wood.

chunks.original_text: 春生秋杀，自然之道也。 诀曰：用火微微，不失节候。 万物自熟，河车之义。 诀曰：子者，火候先在抽添。 一云河者，北之位。 车者，般载之义。 一云子是金，河是水，故曰子河车。 地符直卦节候进退图 诀曰：本用四卦法，日月四时，直符循环，一如车脚，转运阴阳，成数造化，载运万物。 故在律纪月节，有五六讳，奉日使兼并。 六十四卦，刚柔有表裹，朔旦长直事，至暮蒙当受，昼夜各一卦用之。 次序既末主晦爽终，即复更始进退爻象，并在此直符。 从一至九，金虎吐精，用诀直符，不载於此。 诀曰：托附阴阳爻象，六十四卦立喻也。 但发泄用火之时，便是十一月用事，受阳节候也。 十一月初九，潜龙勿用。 地雷复，豫直。 十二月九二，见龙在田。 地泽临，萃直。 正月九三，君子终日乾乾。 地天泰，否直。 二月九四，或跃在渊。 天雷无妄，大壮直。 三月九五，飞龙在天。 天泽履，夫直。 四月上九，亢龙有悔。 纯乾直，阳气交腾。 右阳生六位，极阳之卦，亢龙大过，法象於天，故云自子终於巳。 五月一阴生。 天风妮，小畜直。 六月二阴生。 天山遁，大畜直。 七月三阴生。 天地否，泰直。 八月四阴生。 风地观升直。 九月五阴生。 山地剥，谦直。 十月六阴生。 纯坤直。 右阴生六位，极阴之卦，气潜伏法象於地，故曰自午讫於亥。 震主春木。 生三，成八。 离主夏火。 生二，成七。 诀曰：证前十五日白，月火木用事，故七八也。 兑主秋金。 生四，成九。 坎主冬水。 生一，成六。 诀曰：证后十五日黑，月金水用事，故九六也。 并是直符六爻，用节卦翻译气候，五行相克之数。 故知七八数十五，九六亦相应，道自毕也。 一二三四五，并是五行之基。 诀曰：一者，北方壬癸水。 二者，南方丙丁火。 三者，东方甲乙木。 四者，西方庚辛金。 五者，中央戊己土。 经曰：父少而子老。 父者，天铅，丹砂铅也。 子者，从父而出，金黑铅，故父少而子老。 子不定，父数世五。 水火金木土，五行移易万物。 五日一候，五五二十五，故父年二十五也。 子数不定，子年般载，运动不定，故知父少而子老。 举世不知万物，从五行而生成父母也。 用火 诀曰：六爻直符，运卦用火，斤两从纯坤起，终於坤，周而复始也。 诀曰：一月换一鼎，故用九鼎，即止。 第十鼎任意消息，用不用并得用之转妙，绿是生金之本气也。 故云土釜，土釜曰母，母金鼎也。 诀曰：其金鼎依运气候，十五日金性灭，三十日成丹。 运至十月，不用本土为鼎，子母脱胎，九转九鼎。 九者，火用事。 鼎者，母用事也。 凡丹象人、从受气后三百七十日而生，九月是阴阳俱盛，十月土王，故子母相分，故名脱胎。 还丹象人，四气足而生，亦如婴儿，乳育三年，大元气足，而成金丹。 乃为黄誉，变转却归北方，黑色通透，始得．名大还。 世人不知之矣。 子是药，母是鼎，感气相生，相产相伏，相制相杀，迭盛迭衰，升降在鼎，飞伏上下，阴阳相管，交会吞食，四物相薄，君臣相临。 土性生，金性死，火性灭，水性个。 四物者，阳中阴，阴中阳。 但以本土为轴辖，直符运动，故有四物，各居一方，四物性并灭，归一返本，故名金丹。 诀曰：守运一年，饵一两半，凡病不侵。

*Wind-Earth Guan* (Contemplation), aligned with *Sheng* (Ascending).

**Ninth month, fifth yin arises.**
*Mountain-Earth Bo* (Splitting Apart), aligned with *Qian* (Modesty).

**Tenth month, sixth yin arises.**
*Pure Kun* (The Receptive) governs.

**Right: The Six Yin Positions**
The yin arises to its extreme—
the hexagram of qi lying hidden,
modeled on earth,
thus from *wu* to *hai*.

**Zhen** governs spring wood:
generating three, completing eight.

**Li** governs summer fire:
generating two, completing seven.

The formula states: Verifying the preceding fifteen days as white,
the moon’s fire and wood govern—hence seven and eight.

**Dui** governs autumn metal:
generating four, completing nine.

**Kan** governs winter water:
generating one, completing six.

The formula states: Verifying the following fifteen days as black,
the moon’s metal and water govern—hence nine and six.

All are the straight tally’s six lines,
employing hexagram nodes to interpret qi and seasons,
the numbers of the Five Phases overcoming one another.
Thus, seven and eight sum to fifteen,
nine and six likewise correspond—
the Dao is complete.

One, two, three, four, five—
all are the foundations of the Five Phases.

The formula states:
One is the northern *ren gui* water.
Two is the southern *bing ding* fire.
Three is the eastern *jia yi* wood.
Four is the western *geng xin* metal.
Five is the central *wu ji* earth.

The classic states: "The father is young, the child is old."
The father is celestial lead—
cinnabar lead.
The child emerges from the father—
black lead of metal.
Thus, the father is young, the child is old.

If the child is not fixed, the father’s lineage spans five generations.
Water, fire, metal, wood, earth—
the Five Phases shift and transform the myriad things.
Five days make one *hou*,
five *hou* make twenty-five—
thus the father’s age is twenty-five.
The child’s number is unfixed,
its age conveyed and revolving without constancy—
hence the father is young, the child is old.

The world does not know that the myriad things
arise and are completed from the Five Phases as parents.

**Employing Fire**
The formula states: The six lines of the straight tally,
revolving hexagrams to employ fire—
weights and measures begin with *Pure Kun*,
end with *Kun*,
cycling without cease.

The formula states: One cauldron is changed each month,
thus nine cauldrons are used before stopping.
The tenth cauldron is left to natural ebb and flow—
whether used or not, both yield wondrous transformation,
for this is the original qi of metal’s birth.

Thus, the earthen crucible—
the earthen crucible is called the mother,
the mother of the metal cauldron.

The formula states: The metal cauldron follows the revolving qi and seasons—
after fifteen days, the metal nature perishes;
after thirty days, the elixir forms.
When the cycle reaches the tenth month,
the original earth is no longer used as the cauldron—
mother and child shed their forms,
nine transformations, nine cauldrons.
Nine is the fire in service;
the cauldron is the mother in service.

All elixirs resemble humans—
from receiving qi to birth, three hundred seventy days,
nine months when yin and yang are both abundant,
the tenth month when earth is sovereign—
thus mother and child part,
hence the name *shedding the womb*.

The returning elixir resembles a person—
four qi complete, it is born,
like an infant nourished for three years,
until the great original qi is full,
and the golden elixir is achieved.
This is called *Yellow Fame*,
transforming and returning to the north,
black color penetrating through—
only then is it named *Great Return*.
The world does not know this.

The child is the medicine,
the mother is the cauldron—
responding to qi, they generate one another,
produce and subdue,
restrain and overcome,
alternately flourishing and declining.
Ascending and descending within the cauldron,
flying and hiding above and below,
yin and yang govern each other,
intermingling and devouring,
the four agents pressing upon one another,
ruler and minister attending.

Earth’s nature gives birth,
metal’s nature dies,
fire’s nature extinguishes,
water’s nature unites.
The four agents—
yin within yang, yang within yin.

But with the original earth as the axle,
the straight tally revolves—
thus the four agents,
each dwelling in its quadrant.
When the natures of the four agents all perish,
returning to unity and the root—
this is called the golden elixir.

The formula states: Guard and revolve for one year,
ingest one *liang* and a half—
no illness will assail you.

chunks.original_text: 二年成白道，可饵半两。 三年大元气足成赤道，可饵一分，住世死籍不录。 刀圭制汞为白道，五年，麻子大，饵七粒，以刀圭点铁及汞各一斤，并成赤道，守九年毕，法饵三粒，三尸九蛊尽出，长生不死。 能化五金八石，尽瓦砾等，随本色形成宝。 又用火法曰：所立指喻爻象，手镜火记斤两，托附阴阳，隐秘变化之机，苗裔略同，用之正诀。 假令十一月建子，一阳生爻动火，生数二，成数七，运动般载，如车轮。 一月一阳生，加至五月一阴生，一月退一阳爻，至十月归於土，终於坤，周而复始。 金丹是日月运动，自然成丹。 因燧人改火，后圣用之，同於天火，造化至在，更漏分明，节候用火，斤两运动，渐渐如蒸，四时年月刻漏足，以成金丹，火候所然。 如驱鸡即走，宽又不伏。 但依直符爻象，即金水自伏。 六月阳终於巳，十二月阴终於丑。 诀曰：丹砂，阳气流珠之精，是立乾坤，运水火，应天符，合三才也。 金为月精，以处阴位。 汞含离气，以应阳爻。 天地之灵孕，日月之精。 否极泰来，阴尽阳生。 故云：丹砂木精，得金乃并，三一之道。 三者，火一．者药，故名守一。 又云：砂者，药。 金者，鼎。 故云：三道由一，并在根蒂。 大道至理，得门无二。 砂性温和，无毒，味辛。 元气通灵，万物不枯，名曰黑铅。 黑铅者，砂中自然之液，仰月抽出之液。 故云：黑铅入仰月，配合为夫妻。 阴魂合阳魄，两性自和同。 诀曰：然用五行，乾坤震巽，直符孕育，从建之初一阳生，子午相应，八八相通，以推移刻漏，日月五星，寒暑来往，昼阳夜阴，交会四十五日一节节相临阴阳调顺潜伏，运动输还，巡於六十四卦。 周而复始，水火相从，处无外物，五金八石，由人之造化。 五金，五行也。 八石，八卦也。 诀曰：水得龙而为雨，火得人而运动阴阳。 气用事万物长，龙行雨施万物生。 还丹养育造化，不越五行。 诀曰：直符初发之时，水净不失时，文不过九，武不过九。 九者，阳之极数。 三三如九，大过之极，阴生之首，阴尽阳生，皆顺天道，阴阳为之运动。 若匀金水，即顺节候。 失序金水即亡。 运动如垂温抱卵，受气而生。 用事相生相杀，如寒谷变春，阴阳五行所生互用，皆立喻者也。 诀曰：精，元气。 本生於南方丙丁火，离，寄位二阳之中一阴生，日之魂，阴汞，水也。 受气之足，移位北方壬癸水，坎，寄位二阴之中一阳生，月之魄，阳汞，金也。 水则湛然不动，无为之体也。 火则炎动不已，有为之宗。 将有制无，合成妙道。 故知金生於阴暗之处，始初也，是子午相应。 诀曰：金入中宫，太一庚城。 含育黄炁，混其元精。 赤马守黄乌，苍龙藉白虎，制驭本类相从，故曰参同。 又云：坎离一二，南北独为径。 一者，水。 二者，火。 万物因水而生，因火而成，火金相伐，水土相克，以成大丹。 直符初发在子，十一月，从震而生。 四月火王，极阳合退。 又从巽生，二木渐顺。 汞初伏虽乾，未是火丹。 守运三节名丹砂，五节名金砂、一年名长砂，一名小还丹，二年名还魂丹，一名中还丹。 一千日受气足，名炁兽大还金液丹，饵之不死。 诀曰：修金丹不悟玄理者，盖为不悟丹砂，是铅造化根本。 迷迷相指，错用凡水银、凡铅、金银、雄黄、曾青。

After two years, the White Way is achieved—ingest half a *liang*.
After three years, the Great Original *qi* is full and the Red Way is achieved—ingest one *fen* to dwell in the world while death’s register omits your name.
A *daogui* measure refines mercury into the White Way; after five years, ingest seven grains the size of sesame seeds. With a *daogui* measure, transmute one *jin* each of iron and mercury into the Red Way. After nine years of guarding and revolving, ingest three grains—the Three Corpses and Nine Worms will all depart, and you will attain longevity without death.
You will be able to transform the Five Metals and Eight Stones, turning even tiles and pebbles into treasures according to their original colors.

The fire method states: The established symbolic trigrams, hand-mirror fire records of weights, and reliance on yin and yang conceal the mechanism of hidden transformations. Though the descendants’ methods differ slightly, the essential technique remains the same.
For example, in the eleventh month, when *jianzi* begins, the first yang line stirs the fire. The generating number is two, the completing number seven—movement and bearing proceed like a wheel.
In the first month, one yang arises; by the fifth month, one yin arises. Each month, one yang line retreats until the tenth month, when all returns to earth, ending in *kun*—then the cycle begins anew.
The Golden Elixir is the movement of the sun and moon, naturally forming the elixir.
Since Suiren altered fire, later sages have used it, aligning with celestial fire. The utmost of creation lies herein—timekeeping is precise, seasonal fire adjustments and weight movements proceed gradually, like steaming. When the four seasons, months, and hours are fulfilled, the Golden Elixir is complete, for the fire-timing dictates it.
If driven too hastily, it flees like a chicken; if too lenient, it will not submit. But by following the straight tally’s trigrams, gold and water will naturally obey.

In the sixth month, yang ends at *si*; in the twelfth month, yin ends at *chou*.
The formula states: Cinnabar is the essence of flowing yang pearls, establishing *qian* and *kun*, moving water and fire, responding to celestial tally, and harmonizing the Three Powers.
Gold is the essence of the moon, dwelling in the yin position. Mercury contains the *qi* of *li*, corresponding to the yang line.
The numinous embryo of heaven and earth, the essence of the sun and moon—when the negative reaches its extreme, the positive arises. Thus it is said: Cinnabar is the essence of wood, which merges with metal—this is the Way of the Three-in-One.
The Three are fire; the One is the medicine—hence the name "guarding the One."
It is also said: Cinnabar is the medicine; gold is the cauldron. Thus, the Three Ways derive from the One, all rooted in the fundamental.
The supreme principle of the Great Way admits no second gate.
Cinnabar’s nature is mild and non-toxic, its flavor pungent. The original *qi* communicates with the numinous, and all things do not wither—it is called Black Lead.
Black Lead is the natural liquid within cinnabar, the liquid drawn out by the upturned moon.
Thus it is said: Black Lead enters the upturned moon, pairing as husband and wife. Yin soul unites with yang spirit, and the two natures naturally harmonize.

The formula states: Employ the Five Agents—*qian*, *kun*, *zhen*, and *xun*—the straight tally nurtures from the inception of *jian*, when the first yang arises. *Zi* and *wu* correspond, eight eights interconnect, shifting with the hours. The sun, moon, and five planets, the coming and going of cold and heat, day as yang and night as yin—every forty-five days, a new phase arrives. Yin and yang adjust and submit, moving and returning, circulating through the sixty-four hexagrams in endless cycles. Water and fire follow one another, dwelling without external things—the Five Metals and Eight Stones are subject to human transformation.
The Five Metals are the Five Agents; the Eight Stones are the Eight Trigrams.

The formula states: Water meets the dragon and becomes rain; fire meets man and moves yin and yang. *Qi* governs the growth of all things; the dragon’s movement and rain’s descent bring all things to life.
The Reverted Elixir nurtures creation, not exceeding the Five Agents.
The formula states: When the straight tally first stirs, water is pure and timing is not lost. The civil fire does not exceed nine; the martial fire does not exceed nine.
Nine is the extreme of yang. Three threes make nine—the utmost of *daguo*, the inception of yin’s birth. When yin is exhausted, yang arises—all follows the Dao of heaven, with yin and yang in motion.
If gold and water are balanced, the seasonal nodes are followed. If the sequence is lost, gold and water perish.
Movement is like a silkworm warming and hatching eggs, receiving *qi* to generate life. The workings of mutual generation and destruction resemble the transformation of a cold valley into spring—yin and yang, the Five Agents, mutually employ one another, all established through analogy.

The formula states: Essence is original *qi*. It is born in the southern fire of *bing* and *ding*—*li*, lodged in the two yang lines with one yin arising, the sun’s soul, yin mercury, water.
When its *qi* is full, it shifts to the northern water of *ren* and *gui*—*kan*, lodged in the two yin lines with one yang arising, the moon’s spirit, yang mercury, metal.
Water is still and unmoving, the body of non-action. Fire is blazing and ceaseless, the ancestor of action. Bringing the active under the control of the inactive completes the wondrous Way.
Thus, know that metal is born in dark yin places—this is the inception, the correspondence of *zi* and *wu*.

The formula states: When gold enters the Central Palace, it is the Great One’s *geng* city. It nurtures the yellow *qi*, blending its original essence.
The Red Horse guards the Yellow Crow; the Azure Dragon rides the White Tiger. Control and submission follow their kind—hence the name *Cantong*.
It is also said: *Kan* and *li* are one and two—south and north alone form the path.
One is water; two is fire. All things are born through water and completed through fire. Fire and metal contend; water and earth overcome—thus the Great Elixir is achieved.
The straight tally first stirs in *zi*, the eleventh month, arising from *zhen*. In the fourth month, fire reigns, extreme yang retreats. Then it arises from *xun*—the two woods gradually submit.
Though mercury is initially subdued in *qian*, it is not yet the Fire Elixir. After guarding and revolving for three phases, it is called Cinnabar Sand; after five phases, Gold Sand. After one year, it is called Long Sand or the Lesser Reverted Elixir; after two years, the Soul-Returning Elixir or the Middle Reverted Elixir.
After one thousand days, when the *qi* is full, it is called the *Qi* Beast Great Reverted Golden Liquid Elixir—ingesting it grants immortality.

The formula states: Those who cultivate the Golden Elixir without awakening to the mysterious principle fail because they do not comprehend that cinnabar is the root of lead’s transformation. Lost in confusion, they mistakenly use common mercury, common lead, gold, silver, realgar, and azurite.

chunks.original_text: 不知凡铅是世银之母，雄是药之子，砂是铅之母，黄是土，土是砂之父母。 曾属甲，火之父母。 青属木，位束方。 世人不悟，错用水银、凡金银铅、雄黄丫曾青为药，或为鼎器，或为子母，或炼铅取花，及杂石为药，自古至今，未有得者。 夫道之根本，神仙之道在一於目前。 丹砂木精，得土而生，得土而死，生灭不离於五行，互用更为父母，相伐相生成形也。 诀曰：气能存生，内丹也。 药能固形，外丹也。 服饵长生，莫过於内外丹，日月之华气。 华气者，丹砂元和之气，并是性命之本。 除内外丹精外，五金二青，四黄杂石，磁誉五矾等，并不在议限。 诀曰：只如水银，孤阴寡阳，能腐骨搜髓。 金性损肝，银性损脾，铜性损肾，铅锡损胃，四黄大毒，并有质性，绝阳而损元和之气，但指於一金一石，乃非凡金石也。 世问六水，皆有大毒。 饵之纵目下未虞，终为大害。 丹砂如有傍小门制之，能治世疾，小益延驻，不可长生。 法曰：用炮硫雄曾四味为器，相伏即得。 如用诸毒药抑遏，感气聚杂而成，即不可饵也。 慎之。 诀曰：凡铅是世银之母，在矿受阳气足，性自伏火，坏出即世银是也。 诀曰：水银与丹砂中水银，形貌虽相似，然象人男与女俱别。 丹砂象男，太阳曰之精魂，能留人性命。 内自有水银相制伏，不与外水银情合、及外物抑遏而得，故益人性命。 凡水银象女，太阴月之精魄，能夺人性命，孤阴寡阳，有大毒，不可饵也。 诀曰：水银阴阳性虽异同，是天地之精，象男女阴阳有异。 丹砂有傍小门制之，即用凡铅为器，匡郭成药。 诀曰：世人不知黄白之根基，错用凡水银、凡铅金银为至药。 殊不知汞生於铅，砂产於金。 金丹但知铅本气而成，何得遗本，存乎外物。 铅者，子，丹之精也。 气者，母，本土生精之土，故名本铅气。 诀曰：天铅者，朱铅也。 金本从铅中生，即是子隐母胎。 又子藏於金中，即是母隐子胎。 铅者，黄芽。 黄者，土。 芽者，砂。 土能生芽，故云黄芽也。 铅汞者，本是七宝之良媒，五金之筋髓，解则百事俱通，迷则百途并塞。 然铅制汞能伏铅铅汞汞相成合为黄白之道。 诀曰：一阴一阳之为道，一金一石之为丹。 石乘阳而热，金得阴而寒。 此乃魂魄相应，理势必然。 夫石液定魂，金精定魄，非阴阳感化，谅九幽之可待。 故曰：君子好述，淑女之良配。 河上姥女，灵而最神。 得火即飞，不见垢尘。 鬼隐龙匿，莫知所存。 将欲制伏，黄芽为根。 傥不入黄芽，独烧水银，虽器厚盈尺，固塞百重，火动即飞，莫之能止，须臾去尽，不见纤毫，如鬼隐冥中，龙匿水府，纵有离娄之目，亦不能睹踪也。 使水不能东西，黄芽之力也。 元君诀曰：黄芽者，五行甲子是也。 甲属木，木是阳之父母。 母属地之气，冬至后一阳冲，其曰一阳生，萌芽受气於母土，名甲。 甲依土吐，甲以生芽。 芽依於母，母曰坤，即是癸之黄芽。 六甲之位，囚死休废，同其一甲，在癸而绝位。 五谷五菜，草木茂荣，万类胎卵，药物人民，皆从黄芽生，阳气氤氲，运动地为，胎息为气。 万物以春夏发泄为黄芽，秋冬收敛同成熟，各归其色及本味，不改旧容，故名还丹之义，反本也。 夫人改常必死，物改色必坏。

The common lead is the mother of worldly silver; realgar is the child of the medicine; cinnabar is the mother of lead; yellow is earth, and earth is the parent of cinnabar. Azurite belongs to *jia*, the parent of fire; azurite belongs to wood, stationed in the east. The unenlightened mistakenly use mercury, common lead, gold, silver, realgar, and azurite as medicines, or as crucibles and vessels, or as mother and child, or refine lead to extract its flower, or mix stones into the medicine—from ancient times to the present, none have succeeded.

The root of the Dao, the path of immortality, lies in unity before one’s eyes. Cinnabar, the essence of wood, is born from earth and dies in earth; its arising and ceasing do not depart from the Five Phases. They alternately serve as parents, mutually overcoming and generating to form substance.

The formula states: *Qi* sustains life—this is the Inner Elixir. Medicine preserves form—this is the Outer Elixir. For attaining long life through ingestion, nothing surpasses the Inner and Outer Elixirs, the radiant *qi* of the sun and moon. This radiant *qi* is the primordial harmonious *qi* of cinnabar, the very foundation of nature and life. Beyond the essence of the Inner and Outer Elixirs, the five metals, two azurites, four yellows, miscellaneous stones, magnetite, and five alums are not within the scope of discussion.

The formula states: Consider mercury—solitary yin, widowed yang—it corrodes bones and searches marrow. Gold damages the liver; silver damages the spleen; copper damages the kidneys; lead and tin damage the stomach. The four yellows are highly toxic, all possessing material nature, severing yang and harming the primordial harmonious *qi*. To speak of a single metal or stone is not to speak of common metals or stones. The six waters of the world are all highly toxic; though no immediate harm may appear upon ingestion, they ultimately cause great injury. Cinnabar, if governed by minor auxiliary methods, can treat worldly illnesses and slightly prolong life, but it cannot grant immortality.

The method states: Using the four ingredients—prepared sulphur, realgar, and azurite—to make vessels, when they mutually subdue one another, success is achieved. If various toxic medicines are suppressed and forced together, the resulting conglomeration of *qi* is impure and cannot be ingested. Exercise caution.

The formula states: Common lead is the mother of worldly silver; within the ore, it receives sufficient yang *qi* and naturally subdues fire. When smelted, it becomes worldly silver.

The formula states: Mercury and the mercury within cinnabar may appear similar in form, yet they differ as distinctly as man and woman. Cinnabar resembles man, the essence and spirit of the Great Yang sun, capable of preserving human nature and life. It inherently contains mercury to subdue and restrain itself, neither mingling with external mercury nor being forced by external substances—thus it benefits human nature and life. Common mercury resembles woman, the essence and soul of the Great Yin moon, capable of seizing human nature and life. Solitary yin, widowed yang, it is highly toxic and cannot be ingested.

The formula states: Though the yin and yang natures of mercury differ, they are both the essence of heaven and earth, resembling the distinction between male and female yin and yang. When cinnabar is governed by minor auxiliary methods, common lead may be used as a vessel to frame and complete the medicine.

The formula states: The unenlightened do not know the root of the Yellow and White; they mistakenly use common mercury, common lead, gold, and silver as supreme medicines. Little do they realize that mercury is born from lead, and cinnabar is produced from gold. In the Golden Elixir, one must know that lead is the foundation of *qi* and its transformation—how can one abandon the root and rely on external things? Lead is the child, the essence of cinnabar; *qi* is the mother, the earth that generates essence—hence it is called the root lead *qi*.

The formula states: Celestial lead is vermilion lead. Gold is born from lead, meaning the child is concealed within the mother’s womb. The child is also hidden within gold, meaning the mother is concealed within the child’s womb. Lead is the Yellow Sprout; yellow is earth; sprout is cinnabar. Earth can generate sprouts, hence it is called the Yellow Sprout. Lead and mercury are the fine matchmakers of the Seven Treasures and the marrow of the Five Metals. When understood, all matters become clear; when deluded, all paths are blocked. Thus, lead restrains mercury, and lead and mercury mutually complete one another to form the Way of the Yellow and White.

The formula states: The Dao consists of one yin and one yang; the Elixir consists of one metal and one stone. Stone rides the yang and is hot; metal receives the yin and is cold. This is the mutual resonance of spirit and soul, an inevitable principle. Stone liquid stabilizes the spirit; metal essence stabilizes the soul. Without the interaction of yin and yang, how could one await the depths of the Nine Darks?

Thus it is said: The gentleman seeks a fine companion, as the virtuous maiden is his perfect match. The Old Woman of the River is numinous and most divine. When she meets fire, she flies, leaving no trace of dust. Ghosts hide and dragons conceal themselves—none know where they reside. To subdue her, the Yellow Sprout is the root. If one does not enter the Yellow Sprout and burns mercury alone, even with a vessel a foot thick and sealed a hundredfold, when fire is applied, it will fly away, leaving nothing behind in an instant, like a ghost vanishing into darkness or a dragon hiding in the watery abyss. Even with the eyes of Li Lou, one could not perceive its trace. That water cannot flow east or west is the power of the Yellow Sprout.

The formula of the Primordial Lord states: The Yellow Sprout is the *jia-zi* of the Five Phases. *Jia* belongs to wood, the parent of yang. The mother belongs to the *qi* of earth. After the winter solstice, one yang surges forth—this is called the birth of one yang. The sprout receives *qi* from the mother earth and is named *jia*. *Jia* relies on earth to sprout; the sprout depends on the mother. The mother is *kun*, which is the Yellow Sprout of *gui*. The position of the Six *Jia* is imprisoned, dead, resting, or abandoned—all share one *jia*, which is extinguished in *gui*. The Five Grains, Five Vegetables, flourishing grasses and trees, the myriad creatures born from wombs and eggs, medicinal substances, and people—all arise from the Yellow Sprout. The yang *qi* is warm and diffuse, moving the earth to act, breathing as a fetus breathes. All things in spring and summer disperse and grow as the Yellow Sprout; in autumn and winter, they contract and mature, each returning to its color and original flavor, unchanged in form—hence the meaning of Reverted Elixir is to return to the root. If a person alters their constant nature, they must die; if a thing changes its color, it must decay.

chunks.original_text: 乃知药物径运动，阳气般载，不改旧容，与天火同造化，还丹受气，反本也。 阳气照曜，凝结自然之道，故曰黄芽。 世人莫知天地三光，清浊初分，人民万物，皆从黄芽，不越五行而生。 黄芽者，萌芽伸屈始初也。 因阳而结，因阴而生，阴阳交接。 当受气之时，初为混沌。 清浊之后，始有黄芽。 在甲曰黄，在句曰萌，在伸曰芽，故名黄芽。 乃知元不离於五行，五行金木水火土也。 水曰润下，火曰炎上，金曰从革，木曰曲直，土曰稼穑。 诀曰：天地大道，万物久长，元和之气，长生不过日月星辰，阴阳五行，尽依土而生，终归於土。 随四时更变然有期，亦是自然之道。 假令毛脂，含受太阳气一千年，化为伏神。 又一千年为琥珀，又一千年为水精。 皆是日月之华气，照曜成精。 又假如蟾蚝弄月，蚌蛤有珠。 并是采弄含受太阴月华之气，成胎为珠。 其珠是月之阴魄所结，二味并堪服食，偏治肺气、惊邪、健忘。 以木蜜为丸，如麻子大，食后津下三丸蚌珠，能制汞。 夫人内修道德，元和之气冲融，修养含道，结精为珠，自然长生。 珠居於赤水中，赤水血也。 假令禽兽虫蚁鱼蟹垫伏者，皆得元和之气，所托存生，非关父母教令，得悟之哉。 自固其志，音声相和，物类相感，有无相贯，阴阳抱而全其大道，二气和合，有无相别，无有相成，成其真道也。 河车者，五金之主，亦北之位。 水能渡车，般载万物，轮还不住，是阳居阴位，阴合阳精，金汞相得，故曰河车也。 元和之道祖，立天地，调阴阳，四时行焉，万物生焉。 受气曰命，最灵曰人，人福莫大於生，祸莫大於死。 既恶其死，又欲其生，为失道而不得生也。 勉之勉之。 且余所注类异诸家，义合正经，理契大道，论卦象则火候为先，择阴阳则药物为正。 参者，杂也。 水土金三物，同为一家，如符若契，契其一理，故曰参同。 诀曰：万物非日月不生，金水非火土不成，金水则变化之元，火土乃阴阳之始。 天地混沌之时，天地默然，虽未变化，终为万物之根。 金白水黑，相会气中，状如鸡子。 阳燧以取火，非日不生光。 犬戎以火镜盛艾，化之须臾。 则火出象还丹，阴阳金火。 大唐国内时亦有之，书不尽言，言不尽意。 然则圣人之意，其不可见乎。 若用凡水银为金丹者，妄人也。 言朱砂未得理者，不知道也。 即去真远矣。 或曰：用凡水银、凡铅而为之者，无灵。 盖不足悟水银真铅之正体，唯赞凡铅之功效。 不说水银之精妙，必以一事而成，不得兼而美之耳。 若用凡铅为药，即去道乖远。 若安水银为金丹，即不是真法。 若悟之者，正以水银、火铅为主。 但得铅本气，遇五而成丹，不遗本也。 若悟元化，一施妙用无极。 若以外物为情，则性不可合。 以水银代汞，则铅不可亲。 性不可合三宫，其可固乎。 铅不可亲八石，岂能妙乎。 金重如本初，金不失其重，日月形如常。 阴汞不失斤两，是日与月金重，不失本初。 我命在铅，铅不失天。 铅还丹成，金亿万年。 铅者二汞，本一体无二，故曰天铅。 莫坏我铅，令我命全。 莫破我车，废我还家。 铅者，砂中自生曰铅。 车者，是砂中抽出液曰车。 铅中有金，金中有还，见宝别宝，贤人得道。 铅者砂中自生日，金得火运动月还。

Thus we know that medicinal substances move directly, the yang *qi* bears and transports, yet they do not alter their original form—aligned with the celestial fire in creation. The Reverted Elixir receives *qi* and returns to the root. The yang *qi* shines and congeals by the natural Dao, hence called the Yellow Sprout. People of the world do not know that when the Three Luminaries of heaven and earth first divided into clear and turbid, all people and the myriad things arose from the Yellow Sprout, born without transcending the Five Phases. The Yellow Sprout is the first budding, stretching, and bending of the initial sprout. It coalesces through yang and is born through yin, where yin and yang intersect. At the moment of receiving *qi*, it is initially a primordial chaos. After the separation of clear and turbid, the Yellow Sprout first emerges. In *jia*, it is called "yellow"; in the crescent, it is called "sprout"; in extension, it is called "bud"—hence the name Yellow Sprout. Thus we know the primordial does not depart from the Five Phases: the Five Phases are metal, wood, water, fire, and earth. Water is said to moisten and descend; fire, to flame and ascend; metal, to follow and transform; wood, to bend and straighten; earth, to sow and reap.

The formula states: The great Dao of heaven and earth endures forever; the *qi* of primordial harmony grants long life, yet none surpass the sun, moon, and stars. Yin and yang, the Five Phases, all depend on earth to be born and ultimately return to earth. They follow the four seasons in cyclic transformation—this too is the natural Dao. For instance, animal fat, receiving the *qi* of the great yang for a thousand years, transforms into *fushen*. After another thousand years, it becomes amber; after yet another thousand, it becomes crystal. All are the essence of the sun and moon’s radiant *qi*, congealed into essence by illumination. Another example: toads and frogs playing in the moonlight, clams and oysters bearing pearls—all gather and receive the *qi* of the great yin’s lunar radiance, forming pearls in the womb. These pearls are the congealed yin essence of the moon. Both substances are fit for ingestion, particularly effective for lung *qi*, fright and evil, and forgetfulness. Form them into pills with wood honey, the size of sesame seeds, and take three after meals with saliva—pearls from clams can restrain mercury.

When a person cultivates inner virtue and power, the *qi* of primordial harmony surges and harmonizes. Through cultivation and embracing the Dao, essence congeals into a pearl, naturally granting long life. The pearl resides in the red waters—red waters are blood. Consider birds, beasts, insects, ants, fish, and crabs: all that dwell and endure receive the *qi* of primordial harmony, sustaining life without reliance on parental instruction. How could they attain enlightenment? By steadfast resolve, harmonious resonance in sound, mutual resonance among things, interpenetration of being and non-being, yin and yang embracing to fulfill the great Dao—when the two *qi* harmonize, being and non-being distinguish yet complete each other, realizing the true Dao.

The River Chariot is the master of the Five Metals, also the northern position. Water can ferry the chariot, bearing the myriad things; its wheels turn without cease. This is yang dwelling in the yin position, yin uniting with yang essence—when metal and mercury meet, it is called the River Chariot. The Dao of primordial harmony is the ancestor, establishing heaven and earth, regulating yin and yang. The four seasons proceed, and the myriad things are born. Receiving *qi* is called destiny; the most numinous is humanity. No blessing surpasses life, no misfortune surpasses death. Yet hating death while desiring life is to lose the Dao and fail to attain life. Strive, strive!

Moreover, what I have annotated differs from other schools, its meaning aligning with the orthodox classics, its principle resonating with the great Dao. In discussing hexagrams and images, fire timing comes first; in selecting yin and yang, medicinal substances are primary. *Can* means to blend. Water, earth, and metal—three substances—form one family, like tallying tokens or contracts, uniting in a single principle, hence called *Cantong* (Triple Unity).

The formula states: The myriad things are not born without the sun and moon; metal and water are not perfected without fire and earth. Metal and water are the origin of transformation; fire and earth are the beginning of yin and yang. When heaven and earth were in primordial chaos, they were silent, though not yet transformed, they were ultimately the root of the myriad things. Metal is white, water is black; they meet within *qi*, resembling a chicken’s egg. The yang burning-mirror gathers fire, yet without the sun, it does not emit light. The Dog Rong use a fire-mirror to hold mugwort, transforming it in an instant—thus fire emerges, resembling the Reverted Elixir, the union of yin-yang metal and fire. Such things also exist within the Great Tang’s domain, but "words cannot exhaust speech, nor speech exhaust meaning." Yet can the intent of the sages not be glimpsed?

Those who use common mercury to make the Golden Elixir are deluded. Those who speak of cinnabar without grasping its principle do not know the Dao—they have strayed far from the truth. Some say: Using common mercury and common lead yields no numinosity, for they fail to comprehend the true essence of mercury and true lead, only praising the efficacy of common lead. They do not speak of mercury’s subtlety and wonder, insisting on singular success without acknowledging dual excellence. If common lead is used as medicine, it strays far from the Dao. If common mercury is used for the Golden Elixir, it is not the true method. Those who grasp it rightly take mercury and fire-lead as primary. As long as lead retains its original *qi*, encountering the Five Phases, it forms the Elixir without losing its root. If one comprehends primordial transformation, a single application yields boundless marvels. If one clings to external things as emotion, nature cannot unite. If mercury is substituted for cinnabar, lead cannot be embraced. If nature cannot unite the Three Palaces, how can it be secured? If lead cannot embrace the Eight Stones, how can it be wondrous?

Gold retains its original weight; gold does not lose its heaviness. The sun and moon retain their usual forms. Yin mercury does not lose its weight—this is the sun and moon’s gold, retaining its original heaviness. My destiny lies in lead; lead does not lose heaven. When lead completes the Reverted Elixir, gold endures for ten thousand myriad years. Lead is the two mercuries, originally one body without duality—hence called celestial lead. Do not harm my lead, that my destiny may be preserved. Do not break my chariot, that I may return home. Lead is that which naturally arises within cinnabar; the chariot is the liquid drawn from cinnabar. Within lead is gold; within gold is return. Discerning treasure from treasure, the worthy attain the Dao. Lead is that which naturally arises within cinnabar; gold, through fire’s movement, returns with the moon.

chunks.original_text: 真人言金精黄芽，制水不流溢之力，玄水也。 金精黄芽同名，自生铅也。 水者，是砂中抽出之液。 用铅不用铅，不用得长年。 用铅者，是朱砂自有铅相制。 不用铅者，是世银之母，凡铅也。 铅若不真，至道难亲。 铅若是真，不失家臣。 铅若不真，凡铅也。 铅若是真，朱铅也。 宁修铅中金，是丹砂中自生曰金。 不修金中宝，是凡水银也。 圣人明立喻，以示后学也。 鼎鼎是何鼎，是用生丹砂之本土为鼎也。 药药是何药，是用丹砂中自流生汞为药也。 火铅是丹砂被日月运动，自生出汞，为火铅也。 水银，汞之异名，是丹砂阳气未足，抽出为水银也。 水银在丹砂中含甲，精气未足曰女。 火铅在丹砂中含甲，精气足回然自生曰男。 男女相配，阴阳自得，其情更无异类也。 金丹本乎一物，而无外物入之，阳气运动，故名三一之道。 白者金精，黑者水精，其归一无二。 圣人托喻於周易爻象，运动成丹制伏，皆时逆而用之。 即魂魄丧亡，如日月交蚀失位，不相宾伏。 圣人秘惜之，不肯正论，多有隐秘之言。 从此经诀差互，多有不成。 有鄙之以失，而起大怨者。 金鼎之诀，宜慎守之。 凡药合和，见功难矣。 天道秘泄，或隐言玄象，或托附阴阳，僭说人间，言微理妙群，或自迷而不解。 自羲皇已来，好道求长生者甚众，遇而得之者寡矣。 擅率胸臆而不鉴悟，又不求师受，自立方书，求出世之方，虚自勤苦名山大谷，朽败愚儒，求不死者，未见得之。 食五谷，纵六情，人在阳，鬼在阴。 又不能驱役鬼神，策使阴阳，不得出世之丹，倒皆死没於世。 寒举绵求以自暖，热饮水而乘风驭冻，生於阴阳之界，五行所管，食土之物，死归於土，以身报土，而返本也。 若非遇日月之华气，运转其精液，三一之还丹，焉能度世。 行尸比肩，若坠石投川，往而不返，沦役归化，实可悲夫。 若遇内外金丹，饵之运形驻貌，异常然。 可出阴阳之界，五行不管，死籍不录，鬼神侍卫。 诀曰：道书仙传，秘录丹经。 《龙虎》、《上清经》五相类《周易》爻象，《参同契》歌诀，卷卷述圣人之意。 黄帝、老子、宣尼，二十四圣诸仙，并是得道之仙。 世人迷遇不会，须修行始得之。 次有不显名之士，得而隐之者，不一以为无仙道者，实愚迷哉。 所有歌录经诀爻象，皆露枝条苗裔，不说径门。 自古至今，皆须师受口诀而成，非有分者，不得而学矣。 传得此诀者，秘之宝之，天道不可轻露泄矣。 养虎还自噬，付与不道之人，殃罚七代，谪身为下鬼，长役鬼官，可不惧哉。 得其贤人，犹须探迹，内行不二，征兆有分，始可传受。 仍先虔志，启告百灵，分誓立券，方可传之，切宜慎之。 修行不二，至药无双。 夫人道合元理，自然可遇。 必须勤苦疲劳，无怨，不可仓卒，渔猎而得之。 遇明师，悟於一言大药，只有一门。 而三物水土金，非人问水土金凡物等。 得之魂魄归，长生不死。 但行不二之心，师必自至矣。 金丹内丹得门，饵者不死，与天地齐毕也。 叔诀长生，号肘后诀，以示后学不悟之者。 其造鼎并入金，及直符用卦刻漏，并不载於此，知道者审而详之。 不变色硫黄法 取鸭子去黄白了，以纸拭其中令净，其口须小，候裹乾，取黄细研，以鸡子白拌令浥浥，入鸭子中，以筋头筑令实满，口上以鸡子白和胡粉固令密。

The Perfected One speaks: the golden essence and yellow sprouts possess the power to restrain water from overflowing—this is the Dark Water. The golden essence and yellow sprouts share a name, being the self-generated lead. Water is the liquid drawn from cinnabar. To use lead or not to use lead—without it, one cannot attain longevity. Using lead means the cinnabar naturally contains lead to restrain it. Not using lead refers to the mother of common silver, which is ordinary lead. If lead is not true, the supreme Dao is hard to attain. If lead is true, one does not lose one’s household retainer. If lead is not true, it is ordinary lead. If lead is true, it is cinnabar-lead. Better to refine the gold within lead—this is the gold self-generated within cinnabar. Do not refine the treasure within gold—this is common mercury. The sage clearly sets forth analogies to instruct later learners.

What is the crucible? It is the native soil where raw cinnabar is born. What is the medicine? It is the mercury that naturally flows from cinnabar. Fire-lead is the mercury produced when cinnabar is moved by the sun and moon. Water-silver is another name for mercury, drawn from cinnabar when its yang qi is insufficient. When mercury resides within cinnabar, its essence incomplete, it is called the maiden. When fire-lead resides within cinnabar, its essence complete and self-generated, it is called the youth. Male and female unite, yin and yang naturally harmonize, their union free from any foreign element. The Golden Elixir originates from a single substance, with nothing external added; through the movement of yang qi, it is called the Dao of the Three-in-One. The white is the essence of metal, the black the essence of water—they return to oneness without duality. The sage borrows the hexagrams of the *Zhouyi* as metaphors, moving and refining the elixir through reversal of time. When the hun and po are lost, like the sun and moon eclipsing and losing their positions, they do not submit to one another. The sage guards this secret, unwilling to speak plainly, often using veiled language. From this, scriptural instructions diverge, and many fail to succeed. Some, despising the loss, incur great resentment.

The method of the golden crucible must be guarded with care. When medicines are combined, achieving efficacy is difficult. The heavenly Dao is secretly revealed, sometimes hidden in celestial images, sometimes attached to yin and yang, falsely expounded among men. Its words are subtle, its principles profound, yet some remain deluded and uncomprehending. Since the time of Fuxi, those who sought the Dao and long life have been many, but those who encountered and attained it have been few. Relying on their own conjectures without discernment, and without seeking a teacher’s instruction, they compose their own formulas, seeking the way to transcend the world. In vain, they toil in famous mountains and deep valleys, decaying like foolish scholars. Those who seek immortality never attain it. Eating the five grains, indulging the six desires, man dwells in yang, ghosts in yin. Unable to command ghosts and spirits or direct yin and yang, they fail to obtain the elixir of transcendence and all perish in the world. Like seeking warmth by grasping silk in the cold or drinking water to ride the wind in the heat, born within the bounds of yin and yang, governed by the five phases, consuming earthly things, they return to earth at death, repaying the earth with their bodies to revert to their origin.

Without encountering the radiant qi of the sun and moon, circulating their essence and fluids, and refining the Reverted Elixir of the Three-in-One, how can one transcend the world? They crowd together like walking corpses, like stones cast into rivers, gone without return, sinking into servitude and transformation—truly pitiable. But if one encounters the inner and outer Golden Elixir and consumes it, the body is transformed and appearance preserved in an extraordinary manner. One can escape the bounds of yin and yang, free from the five phases’ control, unrecorded in the registers of death, with ghosts and spirits as attendants.

The scripture states: Daoist books and immortal transmissions, secret records of elixir classics—*The Dragon and Tiger*, *The Supreme Clarity Scripture*, the five works akin to the *Zhouyi* hexagrams, the songs and verses of the *Cantong Qi*—all expound the sages’ intent. The Yellow Emperor, Laozi, Confucius, and the twenty-four Perfected Immortals were all immortals who attained the Dao. Worldly people, deluded and uncomprehending, must cultivate practice to achieve it. There are also unnamed individuals who attained it and concealed it. Those who deny the existence of the immortal Dao are truly foolish and deluded. All the songs, records, scriptural instructions, and hexagrams reveal only branches and leaves, not the direct path. From ancient times to the present, one must receive oral instructions from a teacher to succeed; without the proper destiny, one cannot learn it. Those who transmit this method must treasure and guard it, for the heavenly Dao must not be lightly revealed. Nurturing a tiger invites it to bite you; entrusting it to the unworthy brings calamity for seven generations, demoting one to a lowly ghost, eternally serving the ghost officials—how can one not fear this?

Even when one finds a worthy person, one must still examine their conduct. Only those of unwavering inner practice and destined signs may receive the transmission. One must first purify one’s intent, invoke the hundred spirits, swear oaths, and establish a covenant before passing it on—this must be done with utmost care. With a mind of unwavering practice, the teacher will surely come.

The Golden Elixir and Inner Elixir, once their gate is attained and consumed, confer immortality, equaling heaven and earth in duration. The secret method of long life, called the *Elbow-Behind Method*, is revealed to later learners who fail to comprehend. **Method for Unchanging-Colored Sulfur:**
Take a duck egg, remove the yolk and white, and wipe the inside clean with paper. The opening should be small. Once dry, take fine yellow sulfur, grind it, and mix it with egg white until slightly moist. Fill the egg with this mixture, packing it tightly with a chopstick. Seal the opening with egg white mixed with lead powder to ensure it is airtight.
